title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Northern and North-central provinces and in Trincomalee district, today (08), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Police open fire at car near checkpoint in Matara
byline: The Police have opened fire at a vehicle that failed to comply with an order to stop at a roadblock in the Wellamadama area of Matara, according to police sources.

title: US air traffic control staffing hit for second day, delaying flights
byline: Air traffic control staffing issues are delaying flights for a second straight day at numerous U.S. airports as the government shutdown reaches its seventh day, the Federal Aviation Administration said in a notice on Tuesday.

title: Gazette issued with measures to prevent spread of African swine fever
byline: An extraordinary gazette notification has been issued declaring measures to prevent the further spread of African Swine Fever (ASF), which has been detected in several Divisional Secretariat Divisions across Sri Lanka over the past few months.

title: Suspect in sexual assault of A’pura Hospital doctor granted bail; remanded over separate incident
byline: The suspect who allegedly sexually assaulted a lady doctor at the doctors’ quarters of the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital has been released on bail by the Anuradhapura Magistrate’s Court.

title: Gaza aid flotilla says Israeli forces attack convoy, intercept several boats
byline: The Gaza Freedom Flotilla said on Wednesday its vessels were under attack by the Israeli military, with several boats intercepted while sailing toward the war-ravaged Palestinian enclave.

title: Gold builds on historic rally, soars past $4,000 an ounce for first time
byline: Gold pushed through $4,000 an ounce to hit a record on Wednesday, driven by investors seeking safety from mounting economic and geopolitical uncertainty, alongside expectations of further interest rate cuts by the U.S. Federal Reserve.

title: Sri Lanka’s official reserve up by 1.1% in September 2025
byline: Sri Lanka’s official reserve assets increased by 1.1% to USD 6.24 billion in September 2025, compared to USD 6.17 billion in August 2025, according to the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).

title: UN Committee expresses concern over Sri Lanka’s lack of progress in addressing cases of enforced disappearances
byline: The United Nations Committee on Enforced Disappearances (UNCED) has expressed concerns over Sri Lanka’s purported lack of progress in addressing cases of enforced disappearances, including the performance of the Office on Missing Persons, which has traced only a few of the nearly 17,000 cases it has received.

title: Sri Lankan designer makes history at Paris Fashion Week 2025
byline: Sri Lankan designer Chathuri Samaraweera, Founder and Artistic Director of the “ANAYA” Collection, has made history as the first Sri Lankan to present a collection at the Paris Fashion Week 2025.

title: Over 165,000 vehicle number plates yet been issued, Transport Minister reveals
byline: Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Bimal Ratnayake today (08) acknowledged in Parliament the on-going delay in the process of issuing new vehicle number plates.

title: Grama Niladharis warn of island-wide strike over allowance issue
byline: The Sri Lanka Grama Niladhari Officers’ Association has announced that it will launch an island-wide strike if the proposed budget fails to allocate the allowances due to them.

title: Commuters can pay bus fares using bank cards from Nov. 30 – Transport Minister
byline: Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Bimal Rathnayake has announced that commuters will be able to pay bus fares using bank-issued credit and debit cards on buses equipped with ticket-issuing machines with effect from 30 November 2025.

title: Final session for public consultations on electricity tariff revisions to be held today
byline: The public comments on the proposal submitted by the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) to the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) regarding the revision of electricity tariffs will conclude today (08).

title: AIIB provides $52 million to strengthen Sri Lanka’s power transmission and renewable energy
byline: The Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) and the Government of Sri Lanka have signed a loan agreement for the Kerawalapitiya–Port L Second Transmission Line Project, under which AIIB will provide USD 52 million in sovereign-backed financing to help Sri Lanka unlock its renewable energy potential and advance sustainable development.

title: Supreme Court grants permission to hear FR filed by Shani Abeysekara
byline: The Supreme Court has granted permission to hear three fundamental rights petitions filed by Shani Abeysekara and two others requesting a ruling that their fundamental human rights were violated by being arrested by the Colombo Crimes Division in 2020 without any reasonable suspicion.

title: Cabinet nod given to procure Murban crude oil from Singapore firm
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to award a contract to M/s BB Energy Asia Pte. Ltd. of Singapore to supply four shipments of Murban crude oil.

title: Woman arrested in connection with double murder in Hungama
byline: A woman, the owner of the house where a couple was murdered in Wadigala, Hungama, has been arrested by police in connection with the crime.

title: Four persons arrested over Hungama double murder remanded
byline: The four suspects arrested for their alleged involvement in the brutal murder that took place in Wadigala, Hungama have been remanded until October 22, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Over 165,000 vehicle number plates yet to be issued, Transport Minister reveals
byline: Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Bimal Ratnayake today (08) acknowledged in Parliament the on-going delay in the process of issuing new vehicle number plates.

title: Additional Secretary of Justice Ministry arrested by Bribery Commission
byline: Former Acting Director General of the Office for Reparations and present Additional Secretary to the Ministry of Justice, Sepalika Samankumari, has been arrested by the Bribery Commission on charges of corruption and criminal misappropriation of funds.

title: UK won’t relax visa rules for India, PM Starmer says
byline: Sir Keir Starmer has said the UK will not relax visa rules for India, speaking before he arrived in the country to tout the benefits of a recent trade agreement.

title: “First pay Rs 600 million”: Actress Shilpa Shetty denied permission to travel to Sri Lanka by Bombay HC
byline: The Bombay High Court today denied actress Shilpa Shetty permission to travel to Sri Lanka for a YouTube event, saying she should first pay Rs 600 million in fraud charges before the matter is considered.

title: Hamas says it handed over list of Israelis and Palestinians for swap deal
byline: Hamas said on Wednesday it had exchanged a list of the names of Israeli hostages and Palestinian prisoners to be released under a swap deal and that it was optimistic about talks in Egypt on U.S. President Donald Trump’s plan to end the war in Gaza.

title: Three scientists win Nobel Prize in Chemistry for the development of metal-organic frameworks
byline: The Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences has awarded the 2025 Nobel Prize in Chemistry to Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar M. Yaghi for their work in the development of metal–organic frameworks.

title: Govt extends tax relief for Mattala Airport to attract airlines
byline: The government has decided to extend the concessionary period granted to the Mattala Rajapaksa International Airport in relation to the deviation tax.

title: Order on Manusha Nanayakkara’s anticipatory bail application to be announced next week
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (08) announced that the order on the anticipatory bail application filed by former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara will be delivered on 14 October.

title: 38 women imprisoned with infants during first 8 months of 2025 - PM Harini
byline: A total of 38 women were imprisoned along with their infants during the first eight months of 2025, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated.

title: Approval granted to recruit officers to Bribery Commission on temporary basis
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to appoint appropriate officers among those engaged in the state service, Police service, Audit service and provincial government service as well as in the state corporations on temporary basis to the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.

title: Additional Secretary of Justice Ministry arrested by Bribery Commission granted bail
byline: Former Acting Director General of the Office for Reparations and present Additional Secretary to the Ministry of Justice, Sepalika Samankumari, who was arrested by the Bribery Commission on charges of corruption and criminal misappropriation of funds, has been granted bail.

title: 10% of Sri Lankans suffer from various mental illnesses – Experts
byline: Around 10% of the country’s population suffers from various mental illnesses, the Ministry of Health states.

title: Speaker endorses certificate on the National Building Research Institute Bill
byline: Speaker of House Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne has endorsed the certificate on the National Building Research Institute Bill.

title: PM Harini on India visit: Looking forward to strengthen cooperation in every sphere
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya says she is looking forward to her upcoming visit to India and that she intends to strengthen the long-standing cooperation between the two neighboring nations in every sphere during the visit.

title: India flags testing lapses at pharma firms after cough syrups deaths
byline: Some Indian pharmaceutical firms failed to follow rules that every batch of medicinal ingredients is tested, the country’s drug regulator said on Wednesday (Oct 8), after deaths in the past month of 17 children linked to toxic cough syrups.

title: Price of 22-carat gold sovereign hits Rs. 300,000 for the first time
byline: The price of a 22-carat gold sovereign in Sri Lanka has surpassed Rs. 300,000 for the first time today (08).

title: Buddhist monk begins protest fast demanding reinstatement of ex-President Mahinda’s security
byline: Venerable Rathupaswala Theripaha Siridhamma Thero has commenced a fast today (08) opposite the D.S. Senanayake statue, located near the Carlton House in Tangalle.

title: Duo arrested with 12kg of narcotics in Kadawatha
byline: A woman and a man have been arrested while at a house in ‘Pahala Biyanwila’, Kadawatha, along with 12 kilograms of narcotics this evening (8), police said.

title: Islamic religious observances held to mark TV Derana’s 20th anniversary
byline: An Islamic religious ceremony was held at the TV Derana head office premises today (8), invoking blessings for the 20th anniversary of ‘TV Derana’.

title: Ensuring all teachers are degree holders is a key goal of the current govt – PM Harini
byline: It is a key goal of the current government to gradually ensure all teachers become degree holders, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated.

title: Bid to construct airfield facility complex at Ratmalana Airport approved
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the proposal to award the contract to a private to construct an airfield facility complex at the Colombo International Airport in Ratmalana.

title: Pope Leo tells US bishops to address Trump’s immigration crackdown
byline: Pope Leo told U.S. bishops visiting him at the Vatican on Wednesday that they should firmly address how immigrants are being treated by President Donald Trump’s hardline policies, attendees said, in the latest push by the pontiff on the issue.
